title.narrative: OUTPUT 1: RENFORCEMENT SYSTEME EPAH

description.narrative: By 2016, DINEPA and its partners have norms, standards, technical guidance and monitoring tools on safe drinking water, sanitation and hygiene that sustainably address the needs of children and women, in particular the most vulnerable., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Sanitation, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children, women and their families in rural and poor urban areas, especially the most vulnerable, have gained equitable and sustainable access to safe water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) services as well as to hygiene education

participating-org.narrative: HOPITAL UNIVERSITE D ETAT D HAITI HUEH

sector.narrative: Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water - climate resilience and environmental sustainability

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, DINEPA and its partners have norms, standards, technical guidance and monitoring tools on safe drinking water, sanitationand hygiene that sustainably address the needs of children and women, in particular the most vulnerable.

description.narrative: By 2016, DINEPA and its partners have norms, standards, technical guidance and monitoring tools on safe drinking water, sanitation and hygiene that sustainably address the needs of children and women, in particular the most vulnerable | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/12/2016

title.narrative: Availability and status of dissemination and use of a validated technical guidance for the WASH sector

actual.value: 2016:Available and disseminatedExplanation: Technical guidelines are continuously used as reference document

title.narrative: Availability and use of Situation Analysis of the WASH Sector for decision making

actual.value: 2016:Available and usedExplanation: UNICEF supported DINEPA to develop a country status overview (CSO). A national water and sanitation mapping exercise is on-going and will be completed in 2017. Results will be a decision making tool for planning and prioritization

title.narrative: Availability and the status of dissemination of a validated national strategy on sanitation and drinking water in rural areas

actual.value: 2016:Available for sanitation, but not for waterExplanation: the National strategy for sanitation has been validated and is being disseminated. As for rural strategy, it has been postponed due to the delays incurred by the national sector strategic plan 2016-2025

title.narrative: Status of the launch of the partnership for Sanitation and Water for All and secured financing of the sector by financial partners

actual.value: 2016:EndorsedExplanation: Haiti attended the SWA meeting held in Addis Ababa in March 2016 and is currently preparing the High level meeting scheduled in April 2017
